summary: mycoplasma hominis, Ureaplasma urealyticum, and Ureaplasma parvum are small, fastidious bacteria belonging to the Mollicutes class. they lack a cell wall (preventing staining with Gram stain) and are not sensitively detected on routine bacterial cultures.
